title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: John W. Jordan to John A. McDonnell, May 4, 1868
summary: Jordan relates the details of a demonstration led by the Ku Klux Klan in Staunton. According to Jordan the Klans quite obvious displays have aroused both the white and black communities and threatens the public peace.
keywords: Community Values/Local Behavior, Legal System, Military Authority, Patriotism, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
